alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 08 at 3:45AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .Rounds of showers and thunderstorms with heavy rain will continue to impact the region through this evening. Soaking rain will effect all areas, with the highest rainfall amounts focused along and southeast of the mountains. High rainfall rates will support rapid runoff and flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following areas, Central Somerset, Interior Cumberland Highlands, Northern Franklin, Northern Oxford, Southern Franklin, Southern Oxford and Southern Somerset. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following areas, Belknap, Northern Carroll, Northern Coos, Northern Grafton, Southern Carroll, Southern Coos and Southern Grafton. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A complex storm system will bring multiple rounds of showers and thunderstorms into this evening. The focus for the heaviest rainfall will be from the foothills northward, including the White Mountains and Western Maine Mountains. Repeating showers with heavy rainfall will likely lead to excessive runoff and flash flooding. Locally considerable flooding impacts are possible.
info.instruction: You should monitor the latest forecast and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. If camping near a stream or river in the watch area you should use this time to move belongings to higher ground.

area.areaDesc: Central Somerset; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford; Southern Somerset
